TemplatedControlDesigner Class

Definition

Extends design-time behavior for template-based server controls.

In this Article

public abstract class TemplatedControlDesigner : System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner

HtmlControlDesigner

Constructors

TemplatedControlDesigner()

Initializes a new instance of the TemplatedControlDesigner class.

public TemplatedControlDesigner ();

Properties

ActiveTemplateEditingFrame

Gets the active template editing frame.

public System.Web.UI.Design.ITemplateEditingFrame ActiveTemplateEditingFrame { get; }
Value
ITemplateEditingFrame

An ITemplateEditingFrame that is the currently active template editing frame.

Remarks

Note

The ActiveTemplateEditingFrame property is obsolete. Use the TemplateGroups property to expose or enumerate templates within a designer for template-based controls.

CanEnterTemplateMode

Gets a value indicating whether or not this designer will allow the viewing or editing of templates.

public bool CanEnterTemplateMode { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the designer will allow the viewing or editing of templates; otherwise, false.

DataBindingsEnabled

Gets a value indicating whether the designer allows data binding.

protected override bool DataBindingsEnabled { get; }
Value
Boolean

true, if the designer allows data binding; otherwise, false.

InTemplateMode

Gets a value indicating whether the designer document is in template mode.

public bool InTemplateMode { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the designer document is in template mode; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Note

The InTemplateMode property is obsolete. Use the InTemplateMode property for equivalent control designer functionality.

A document is in template mode when a template is currently being viewed or edited in the forms designer.

TemplateGroups

Gets a collection of template groups, each containing a template definition.

public override System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroupCollection TemplateGroups { get; }
Value
TemplateGroupCollection

A collection of TemplateGroup elements.

Methods

CreateTemplateEditingFrame(TemplateEditingVerb)

When overridden in a derived class, creates a template editing frame for the specified verb.

protected abstract System.Web.UI.Design.ITemplateEditingFrame CreateTemplateEditingFrame (System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateEditingVerb verb);
verb
TemplateEditingVerb

The template editing verb to create a template editing frame for.

Returns
ITemplateEditingFrame

The new template editing frame.

EnterTemplateMode(ITemplateEditingFrame)

Opens a particular template frame object for editing in the designer.

public void EnterTemplateMode (System.Web.UI.Design.ITemplateEditingFrame newTemplateEditingFrame);
newTemplateEditingFrame
ITemplateEditingFrame

The template editing frame object to open in the designer.

Remarks

Note

The EnterTemplateMode method is obsolete. Use the TemplateGroups property to manipulate templates within a designer for template-based controls.

If already in template mode and editing a different template frame, this method calls ExitTemplateMode to save all its templates and close that frame.

ExitTemplateMode(Boolean,Boolean,Boolean)

Closes the currently active template editing frame after saving any relevant changes.

public void ExitTemplateMode (bool fSwitchingTemplates, bool fNested, bool fSave);
fSwitchingTemplates
Boolean

true when switching from one template editing frame to another; otherwise false.

fNested
Boolean

true if this designer is nested (one or more levels) within another control whose designer is also in template editing mode; otherwise false.

fSave
Boolean

true if templates should be saved on exit; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Note

The ExitTemplateMode method is obsolete. Use the TemplateGroups property to manipulate templates within a designer for template-based controls.

GetCachedTemplateEditingVerbs()

Gets the cached template editing verbs.

protected abstract System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateEditingVerb[] GetCachedTemplateEditingVerbs ();
Returns
TemplateEditingVerb[]

An array of TemplateEditingVerb objects, if any.

Remarks

Note

The GetCachedTemplateEditingVerbs method is obsolete. Use the TemplateGroups property to manipulate templates within a designer for template-based controls.

GetTemplateContainerDataItemProperty(String)

Gets the data item property of the template's container.

public virtual string GetTemplateContainerDataItemProperty (string templateName);
templateName
String

The name of the template.

Returns
String

A string representing the data.

Remarks

Note

The GetTemplateContainerDataItemProperty method is obsolete. Use the Templates property of the TemplateGroups collection elements to examine template metadata within a designer for template-based controls.

GetTemplateContainerDataSource(String)

Gets the data source of the template's container.

public virtual System.Collections.IEnumerable GetTemplateContainerDataSource (string templateName);
templateName
String

The name of the template.

Returns
IEnumerable

The data source of the container of the specified template.

GetTemplateContent(ITemplateEditingFrame,String,Boolean)

When overridden in a derived class, gets the template's content.

public abstract string GetTemplateContent (System.Web.UI.Design.ITemplateEditingFrame editingFrame, string templateName, out bool allowEditing);
editingFrame
ITemplateEditingFrame

The template editing frame to retrieve the content of.

templateName
String

The name of the template.

allowEditing
Boolean

true if the template's content can be edited; false if the content is read-only.

Returns
String

The content of the template.

GetTemplateEditingVerbs()

Gets the template editing verbs available to the designer.

public System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateEditingVerb[] GetTemplateEditingVerbs ();
Returns
TemplateEditingVerb[]

The template editing verbs available to the designer.

GetTemplateFromText(String)

Creates a template from the specified text.

protected System.Web.UI.ITemplate GetTemplateFromText (string text);
text
String

The text to retrieve a template from.

Returns
ITemplate

An ITemplate from the specified text.

GetTemplatePropertyParentType(String)

Gets the type of the parent of the template property.

public virtual Type GetTemplatePropertyParentType (string templateName);
templateName
String

The name of the template to return the type of the parent for.

Returns
Type

The type of the object that has the template property.

Remarks

Note

The GetTemplatePropertyParentType method is obsolete. Use the Templates property of the TemplateGroups collection elements to examine template metadata within a designer for template-based controls.

GetTextFromTemplate(ITemplate)

Gets a string of text that represents the specified template.

protected string GetTextFromTemplate (System.Web.UI.ITemplate template);
template
ITemplate

The ITemplate to convert to text.

Returns
String

A string that represents the specified template.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

template is null.

Initialize(IComponent)

Initializes the designer and loads the specified component.

public override void Initialize (System.ComponentModel.IComponent component);
component
IComponent

The control element being designed.

OnBehaviorAttached()

Provides an opportunity to perform additional processing when a behavior is attached to the designer.

protected override void OnBehaviorAttached ();

Remarks

Note

The OnBehaviorAttached method is obsolete. Use the SetAttribute and GetAttribute methods on the Tag property to map properties to styles.

OnComponentChanged(Object,ComponentChangedEventArgs)

Delegate to handle the component changed event.

public override void OnComponentChanged (object sender, System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentChangedEventArgs ce);
sender
Object

The object sending the event.

ce
ComponentChangedEventArgs

A ComponentChangedEventArgs that provides data for the event.

Remarks

This method is called after a property has been changed. It allows the implementer to perform any post-processing that may be needed after a property change.

OnSetParent()

Provides an opportunity to perform additional processing when the parent of this designer is changed.

public override void OnSetParent ();

OnTemplateModeChanged()

Provides an opportunity to perform additional processing when the template mode is changed.

protected virtual void OnTemplateModeChanged ();

Remarks

The ViewEvent event is raised by the designer host for certain actions on a control in the design surface. For example, an event is raised when the user enters or exits template editing mode for a control.

The TemplatedControlDesigner class supplies a default delegate to handle the ViewEvent event. Classes deriving from the TemplatedControlDesigner override the OnTemplateModeChanged method to process events that are raised when the template mode changes for the associated control.

The OnTemplateModeChanged method allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

The default delegate performs the updates that are required for a template mode change event in the base TemplatedControlDesigner class, and then calls the OnTemplateModeChanged method. The base OnTemplateModeChanged method in the TemplatedControlDesigner class returns without performing any additional processing for the event. If a class derives from the TemplatedControlDesigner and overrides the base OnTemplateModeChanged method, the default delegate calls the override method in the derived class.

Use the InTemplateMode property to determine whether the control designer is in template editing mode currently.

SaveActiveTemplateEditingFrame()

Saves the active template editing frame.

protected void SaveActiveTemplateEditingFrame ();

SetTemplateContent(ITemplateEditingFrame,String,String)

When overridden in a derived class, sets the specified template's content to the specified content.

public abstract void SetTemplateContent (System.Web.UI.Design.ITemplateEditingFrame editingFrame, string templateName, string templateContent);
editingFrame
ITemplateEditingFrame

The template editing frame to provide content for.

templateName
String

The name of the template.

templateContent
String

The content to set for the template.

UpdateDesignTimeHtml()

Updates the design-time HTML.

public override void UpdateDesignTimeHtml ();

Remarks

You should call this method to refresh the design-time display if the template frames have been changed without calling methods that update the design-time HTML automatically.
